data.title: Stats and Trivia
data.meta_description: Contributed by the member community of the CM's SATC, the stats and trivia about the Common Man's Standardized Awards for Tamil Cinema are presented here.
data.meta_site_name: the Common Man's Standardized Awards for Tamil Cinema
data.text:
IMPORTANT NOTICE / DISCLAIMER

Did you know?

A person nominated for a particular category from one year could easily defeat the winner of that category from another year — i.e., the winners are at best the winners of the competition of that particular year and cannot be compared with the winners/nominees of other years.

The facts, statements, statistics, and trivia published in this page are entirely contributed by the member community of the CM’s SATC. We do not endorse the superiority/inferiority of anybody that is/maybe established through these facts/statements/statistics/trivia, and we strictly advice reader discretion, for these “items” do not always present the exact picture of the CM’s SATC over the years.

Trivia

~ Karthik Netha has won the most number of awards (4) under single title (#2)

~ The following 6 have won the second most number of awards (3) under single title:

1) Madhan Karky (#2),

2) Pradeep Kumar (#38),

3) Shashaa Tirupati (#3),

4) Shobi (#29),

5) Rajinikanth (#33),

6) Thamarai (#36).

~ Achcham Yenbadhu Madamaiyada, ’96, Monster, Vanamagan — films known for their songs & music — are at the top, with 7, 5, 5, & 4 category-B awards respectively, in the list of films that received most awards in category B.

~ Ghibran, with 4 awards in 2014, holds the record for most number of awards by an individual in a single year.

~ Only 3 of the recipients have retained their Category A award: Harris Jayaraj (Song Album: 2013, 2014); A. R. Rahman (Song Album: 2015, 2016); Sivakumar Vijayan (Cinematography: 2016, 2017).

~ The following 6 have won awards in 4 or more titles overall:

1) Harris Jayaraj – 1, 5, 6, 7, 36

2) M. Ghibran – 1, 5, 6, 7, 36

3) Mani Ratnam – 14, 16, 18, 34

4) A. R. Rahman – 1, 5, 6, 36

Trivia

~ Vaali is the first ever recipient of CM’s SATC — he won it for Best Song (Lyricist).

~ Thalaivar has won Favourite Hero title 3 times — in alternating years: 2014, 2016, 2018.

~ In 2018, the Best Song (#1) award was bagged by Govind Vasantha, who had incidentally made his debut that year. This was the first time a debut composer won award #1.

~ There was a huge drop in the quality of songs from 2018 when compared to the songs from 2017. In 2017, a song ranked at #60 had a rating of 8.5/10 whereas in 2018, a song ranked at #28 had a rating of 8.4/10.

~ Vetri Maaran‘s Vada Chennai holds the record for most number of awards (9) by a film in CM’s SATC history.

Trivia

~ Pradeep Kumar holds the record for most number of award titles (9) by an individual. He has received 2 triple & 2 double awards among them, counting for 15 awards in total.

~ The first film to receive the award from CM’s SATC is Leelai (2012) and the last film to receive the award is Devarattam (2019).

~ Kamal Haasan, having won 3 Category-A awards in 2015, is at the top of the list of people winning more than one award (category A) in a single year.

~ The Special Award for Proud Debut in Tamil has always been won by women: 4 times by actors of Kerala origin; 3 times by actors of Tamil Nadu origin; and once by an actor of Karnataka origin.

Table #1 : Most Awards – Films

Between two films with same number of awards in category A, one which has more awards in category B gets placed first; between two films with same number of awards in both category A & B, one which has more awards in category C gets placed first; between two films with same number of awards in all three categories, one which received awards earlier is placed first.

Trivia

~ The following 7 have gone on to win awards after being awarded Best Debutante/Debutant (or) Best Find (or) #39 (or) #40 previously:

1) Lakshmi Menon – 1,

2) Karthik Subbaraj – 2,

3) Pradeep Kumar – 8,

4) Anirudh Ravichander – 4,

5) R. S. Durai Senthilkumar – 1,

6) Sean Roldan – 1,

7) Shireen Shahana – 1.

~ This is the graph of composer Anirudh in CM’s SATC so far: Best Debut as Music Director in 2012 –> Favourite Song in 2013 –> Best Song in 2017 –> Best Music Direction in 2019.

~ In 2013, director Ram won both award #14 & 18. In 2017, Mani Ratnam would do the same feat.

~ Among all the winners so far, the only hat-trick winner is Shashaa Tirupati (Best Singer Female – 2015, 2016, 2017).
